title: Heart Failure Analysis
text: In this document, I build several models of the heart failure data that are able to handle non-linearities in the predictors, generate predictions and perform model validation.

title: About
text:
This site has been set up as a temporary home for this analysis such that it can be shared with my supervisors.
How to do math in LaTeX:
Inline: \(\alpha\)
Indented:
\[
\hat{y}_i = \beta_0 + \sum_{j=1}^p \beta_j x_{ji}
\]

x = seq(0, 2*pi, by = 0.1)
y = sin(x) + rnorm(length(x), 0, 0.3)
plot(x,y) +
  title("Sinusoidal Simulation")








integer(0)

title: Heart Failure Analysis
text:
Environment
Load the requisite libraries.

library(rms)
library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
library(gtsummary)
library(ggplot2)
library(splines)
library(broom)
library(pROC)
library(knitr)

title: Heart Failure Analysis
text:
Data
Having loaded the various libraries needed, letâ€™s import our heart failure data.

setwd("C:/Users/rmhimdi/OneDrive - University College London/Documents/HeartFailure")
df <- read_excel("simulateddata_LR_NL.xlsx")

Discretise age and recode sex.

df$outcome <- factor(df$outcome, levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("Survived", "Died"))
df$age <- round(df$age, 0)
df$sex <- factor(df$sex, levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("Male", "Female")) 
## Assuming Female = 1 since this seems mildly protective (cf. MAGGIC), but will need to check.

Renaming varibles.

df <- 
  df %>% 
  rename(
    Outcome = outcome,
    Age = age,
    Sex = sex,
    Creatinine = creatineDischarge,
    Sodium = sodiumDischarge,
    Potassium = potassiumDischarge,
    Urea = ureaDischarge,
    S_bp =  sbpAdmission,
    HR = hrAdmission,
    Hb = hbDischarge,
    Diabetes = diabetes,
    COPD = copd,
    IHD = ihd, 
    ValveDisease = valveDisease,
    NYHA_class = nyha,
    PeripheralOedema = peripheralOedema,
    AF = af,
    eGFR = egfr_full
  )

Inspect the processed data.

kable(head(df))
